Bitcoin is far more volatile than stocks, which is a bad thing if seeking less risk, which is what you want to do when the stock market is tanking, you fucking dumbass. You'd only be mitigating losses if crypto moved opposite of stocks, which isn't a reasonable assumption, at all. If you're seeking less risk you go for assets with lower standard deviation (volatility), not higher.

You're probably thinking of diversifying to avoid correlation, but are new to playing make believe investor so you don't know what you're actually doing yet. It's ok, we all learn somehow, and "diversify" is still a good thing to have learned even if you could have learned it from pretty much any movie involving the stock market.

Learn basic investing. I did, spent 6 years doing it professionally. Bitcoin speculation isn't investing.
